Box 1 Louis L. McInnis Papers/Box 1 Folder 15 Louis L. McInnis Papers

en: A. B. Yeager, a merchant in Flatonia, Texas, writes to Professor Louis L. McInnis acknowledging a one-dollar debt owed to the college and requesting credit. Yeager expresses frustration over his experience at the military school, complaining about unfair treatment by Lieut. Crane and lack of promotion despite adequate academic performance and military conduct, which discouraged him from continuing his studies. He offers McInnis a twenty percent commission if the professor can collect a debt from Mr. Boggs and inquires whether a formal resignation is necessary since he has decided not to return to school.

—AND—
=>GENTS' + FURNISHING + GOODS,<=

Flatonia, Tex., Oct 4 1883.

Prof L. L. McInnis,
                        Dear Sir!

                                                      Enclosed
you will find one dollar for which
please give me credit. I am under
obligations to you for informing
me of the fact that I owed the College
1.00/xx . I expect that I will never
see any of that money that
Mr Boggs owes me. I would like
to have gone to school this session
but Lieut Crane's partiality dis–
couraged me —. I know that
I knew my lessons as well as most
of the boys in that school and so far
as military was concerned I had not
a great many demerits — but still no
promotion. — I received only 1 zero
